column1: 'Approved' button on visitor report cannot be stt
column2:
http://www.peerwater.org/projects/110-Arsenic-free-dugwell-PW92SU17-funded-by-Group-Mosaique-Sagney-Canada-/proj_reports/98

Needs to be removed. I 'unapproved' it and it still shows approved after 'Submit'.

Also 'Cancel' takes you to the main report, does not return you to the visitor report.
column10:
10/10/11 10:46:27; rajesh; 
in addition to approve, we may want to have a 'remove' to get junk ones off our system.
column12:
10/10/11 10:46:31; rajesh; 
what to do with the Approve button?

can we make it work? is there a need to?
or 
delete it?

column1: allow more than 2 logins per org
column2:
is it possible to open up # of users to more than 2 per org?
how would it change the ui?

column1: incremental funding for projects
column2:
we need to set up an incremental funding system:

when an app is approved but not funded, we show it needing funds.
as people fund the app, admin can add funds to the app.
(right now can only convert app from 'approved, not funded' to 'approved funded')

when you click on the icon, you see a link to the app, how much money is requested, and how much is funded, how much is left. (similar to akvo).

of course that brings up the problem of providing a way to fund the app!

column1: org view - projects and apps no longer visible after rails 2.2 migration
column2:
compare:
http://www.peerwater.org/organizations/3-El-Porvenir

http://dev.peerwater.org/organizations/3

right column, no info at bottom

column1: search not working well
column2:
search for Rajesh and you get one contact.

search for Annette and you get 2.

why is that?
column10:
10/10/11 10:46:43; ajaya; 
simple. annette is a contact in two diff orgs.
column11:
10/10/11 10:46:45; rajesh; 
and so am i, but i don't show up
column12:
10/10/11 10:46:47; rajesh; 

also search for 'yemen' there are 2 projects (yemen is the country and in the name) and only one shows up. both apps show.
column14:
10/10/11 10:46:51; rajesh; 
on dev,

rajesh|Rajesh shows up once
and annette|Annette twice.
column15:
10/10/11 10:46:53; ajaya; 
I was removing the admin from the serach results. 
Now I removed all the contacts from pwx from search results. You two show up under BPR anyway. 
If you want me to include then let me know

column1: need cancel button on app
column2:
how can you cancel changes you made?
if you have done attach things, it maybe hard to undo, but if you do text changes, you should be able to cancel.

not all folks know to use the back button on the browser.

column1: shouldn't be able to create a new project if funding left is zero
column2:
even though fund remaining is zero, the create project button is there.

it is confusing on the project summary page of the app, and other places it shows up.

column1: 'projects needing funding' improvements
column2:
related to #8577

pwx is not supposed to be the fundraiser, but it needs to provide links to viewers to donate, to fund projects.

we could use the funder info in the cycle and provide a link in the bubble. when they click on it they go to the funder's website and their donate page.

other ideas? want to keep this thought alive.

column1: ability to create links for projects/applicatons on map
column2:
it would be sweet to send a link, for example:

pwx.org/map/proj/15

which opens up the map and highlights the project - bubble above project icon opens up

similarly

pwx.org/map/app/15/links

which opens up the map and the bubble for the app and also the links to reviewers

---
need to understand what the effort is and estimate.
then we can set its priority and maybe do it, move it to 'Z Future' or can the idea.
column10:
10/10/11 10:47:08; rajesh; 
need to understand how we can do this. effort required and any tech issues.
column12:
10/10/11 10:47:12; rajesh; 
this is good.

can we make it so that only one item is on the map?

if i find a project of 'project well' i see the bubble but when i try to find the actual location, its lost among several water drops.

so when the user clicks on 'show on map' it should only have one item on map.

column1: funders projects in right column
column2:
if an org is a funder, the projects it funded should appear in the right column.

(max 5)

when you click on 'More' there should be a report for those projects, just like for "My Projects" and "My Active Projects"

maybe "My Funded Projects"

how will others find this listing?
bpr is the test case and awwc will soon be.
column10:
10/10/11 10:47:17; ajaya; 
we need to discuss what projects makes the cut for this list!! cycles have funders, apps have funders, projects have funders.  for now apps & projects can have these fields null.  So. we need to have a staregy.  Let's talk..

column1: carryover implementer name from the app into the project
column2:
there are 2 fields in the app for 'other implementer'

carry the name field over into the project on the main project report page.

the value should be inherited from application.

since this is a db change, lets make it soon and deploy to qa so we can test.
column12:
10/10/11 10:47:23; rajesh; 
please explain the difference between:

http://www.peerwater.org/projects/118
http://www.peerwater.org/projects/111

one shows implementer fields (they are blank) and one does not (they have data)
column13:
10/10/11 10:47:26; ajaya; 
probably left overs.  it will get carried over if u create the project after these changes went in.

column1: org count bugs
column2:
admin dashboard: 44
click on admin 'organizations': 49
home page: 49
click on home page list: 7 funders, 31 imp, 5 observers, 6 propects = 49

so how come admin dashboard says 44 (if you take out prospects it should be 43)?
there are 2 in peer review so either 43 or 45, but 44 does not make sense.

also, is it possible to get rid of 'draft'? we should count them only after they 'come in' to the system. 'peer review'
column10:
10/10/11 10:47:31; ajaya; 
The ones in the admin screen were all junk. Some old leftovers.

I have cleaned it up.  I haven't excluded the drafts as for real numbers u can do to go home page. The number on admin page shows how many r there total.

aj

changeset:2390
column12:
10/10/11 10:47:35; rajesh; 
want to design this 'Other' and 'Anonymous' funding sources right. 
is creating an org the right way to do it?

if we can't do it now, then we can push this out to the next release. 
this release has enough with multiple funders, so maybe back this stuff until we know what we are doing.

column1: Maintenance cost field too large
column2:
When creating a project, the field for maintenance cost is much larger/wider than it needs to be. It is almost 3x the width of project cost - imagine the project that  needed 3x the funding to maintain it annually. 

http://dev.peerwater.org/projects/129-Tax-the-Big-Guys/edit

column1: errors on admin assigning reviews
column2:
for both apps and orgs (on www & qa), there is an error when review notice is submitted:

http://qa.peerwater.org/organizations/61-Rede-Water-Initiation/reviews/update_reviewers


System Error!
Something has gone wrong. Please try refreshing the page or try again later. We truly apologize for the inconvienence as we work hard to provide good experiences to you and new innovations you can use.

The system administrator has been notified of this error.
column11:
10/10/11 10:47:54; rajesh; 
can't replicate but keeping open for a bit

column1: Give admin access to edit email preferences for users
column2:
For this AWWC round 2, it'd be great if we could reduce the amount of emails users receive. I've sent instrux to participants to uncheck accordingly on their email preferences, but that's one more step. 

It'd be great if admin had access to user's email preferences.

column1: Project locations not appearing
column2:
In current funding cycle, in some of the project apps the location isn't displayed to logged in PWX members, making it seem that they haven't got an icon/location on the PWX map. But they do! 

The following apps don't show any coordinates in their app, but have an icon on the map: 182, 175, 184.

App 186 has an icon and there are coordinates appear on their app.
column10:
10/10/11 10:47:58; rajesh; 
Annette,

Your text is not clear - apps are shown next to their org location if they do not have coordinates.

Are there any apps are not showing on the map?

What do you want done? Clarify and resubmit or close.
column11:
10/10/11 10:48:00; rajesh; 
Apps that are appearing on the PWX map should display their coordinates in their application, otherwise I have no idea how to know who to harass about submitting locations. 

Again, the following apps don't show any coordinates in their app, but have an icon on the map: 182, 175, 184.

App 186 has an icon and their coordinates appear on their app. There's got to be a bug for this to be case.
column12:
10/10/11 10:48:02; ajaya; 
we show location of the organization on the map if the app doesn't have loc info. rajesh?

column1: www.peerwater.org and peerwater.org have differences - favicon

the favicon is a symptom of the differences.

column1: remove get satisfaction from home page
column2: there was no reason to put that and it should be removed so we can deploy to www

column1: video on status report cannot be edited
column2:
when we have a video on the Progress/Status Report, it cannot be edited or deleted.

the embedded youtube text does not show up in the field on the Edit Report page.

in the org profile, it works.
in the application, it works.
in the visitor report, it works when admin edits it.

column1: photos in Progress/Status Reports cannot be deleted by owner
column2:
when an org uploads pictures to Progress/Status Reports, they cannot edit/delete them.

if admin is logged in, admin has the power.

the owner (self) should be able to

column1: org matrix broken with upgrade(?)
column2: peerwater.org/organizations/matrix no longer works

column1: admin dashboard broken on qa
column2:
neil was playing with something (a new cycle) on qa as pwxassist. only thing he did was delete a funder in a cycle. now login as admin and you get: http://qa.peerwater.org/dashboard/admin ActiveRecord::RecordNotFound in Dashboard#admin Showing app/views/dashboard/_admin_rightcolumn.html.erb where line #8 raised: Couldn't find Organization with ID=65 Extracted source (around line #8): 5:
    6: <%ActiveRecord::SessionStore::Session.find(:all, :conditions => [ "updated_at > ?", 7.days.ago], :order => "updated_at DESC").each do |e|%> 7: <%- next unless e.data[:sessionobj].instance_of?(UserSessionMgmt::UserSession)%> 8:
  • <%=e.data[:sessionobj].first_name%> <%=e.data[:sessionobj].last_name%> of <%=link_to Organization.find(e.data[:sessionobj].organization_id).name, organization_path(e.data[:sessionobj].organization_id)%> on <%=e.data[:sessionobj].login_time%> about <%=time_ago_in_words(e.data[:sessionobj].login_time)%> ago
    • 9: <%end%> 10:
11: Trace of template inclusion: app/views/dashboard/admin.html.erb RAILS_ROOT: /bpr/root/home/peerwate/apps/qa/releases/20090613143331 Application Trace | Framework Trace | Full Trace column1: multiple locations for a project
column2:
need to discuss

-----------

can we change so that a project has multiple locations?

how would this show up on the map?

this is important for GV as many villages can be under one project.
column11:
10/10/11 10:48:31; rajesh; 
this works well, but needs one fix and one enhancement:

FIX: project should show up only once on the member dashboard. each location comes up on the dashboard. login in as shivoham (pw pwx) on qa and you can see.


ENHANCE: map of project: show all locations, in addition to the one at a time option.
column12:
10/10/11 10:48:33; rajesh; 
also it would be great if we could add a count of locations to the title like it is in the reports:

Location(s) (10)

a zero would indicate that we need to put one in.

Best would be to test for the value one in which case it shows:

Location

in all other cases it shows:

Location(s) (x)
column16:
10/10/11 10:48:49; rajesh; 
delete not working.

tried on local and qa.

site stays on list, even after page reload.
when primary is deleted, the next location becomes primary, but the primary stays on list as primary.

this is logged in as admin and editing gram vikas project:
http://qa.peerwater.org/projects/150-Water-Sanitation-Beyond-for-61-Villages-MANTRA-2-3-funded-by-Swiss-Agency-for-Development-and-Cooperation-SDC-

column1: approximate flag for location
column2:
can we have an 'approximate' check box at every location for org, app, project?

this should be checked by default.
then when we get accurate data, we can uncheck the box.

this way, we will know not to trust the map - useful for visitors using gps to find projects!
column11:
10/10/11 10:48:57; rajesh; 
seems to work fine, need to put in a help bubble on edit.

since there are no help bubble examples for checkbox, i don't know how to do it.

please help.

column1: visitor cannot upload photos anymore
column2:
after entering visitor report, if you click on upload photos you get login page.

need to give visitors ability to upload photos.

i thought we gave them 24 hours.
column11:
10/10/11 10:49:03; rajesh; 
so now the visitor can upload photos, but the deletion process is not there.

the visitor cannot delete uploaded photos, which might be okay.

however, peer reports that contain photos cannot be deleted by the owner (the poster of the report).

on qa and dev (2 diff versions) have the same problem.

peer report attachments should be deletetable by owner (the peer) and admin.

column1: show ratings tab when not logged in
column2:
show ratings tab when not logged in.

however, don't show the reviewer name or org or any info other than all the ratings.

this will help potential funders who are not members choose projects.

talk to me first before doing it to determine effort, assess what might break, and what testing needs to happen.

column1: withdrawal of app should generate status message to admin
column2: some app actions need to logged - withdrawal
column11:
10/10/11 10:49:12; rajesh; 
does not work, on qa, withdrew a file, logged in as elporvenir

http://qa.peerwater.org/apps/188

and resubmitted. got the submission email, but not the withdrawal email.
column12:
10/10/11 10:49:14; ajaya; 
I thought u said logged.  Nothing said about emailing.

column1: profile last updated field does not work
column2:
on the blueplanetrun profile on www, it says the profile was last updated on sep 8, 08.

i updated address in june.

today i updated video.

and, then as admin, i updated expiration date.

still says sep08 08.

column1: diagram collides with RHS text
column2:
on the "How PWX works" page, the process diagram collides with the text on the right side.

http://qa.peerwater.org/home_page/how_pwx_works

The www does not collide but is awfully close.

column1: create new project not working
column2:
when i create a new project from the manage funding page, once i click submit the project does not go through but rather it stays on the same create project screen.  this is in QA.

http://qa.peerwater.org/apps/173-Malgudi-Days/projects

10/10/11 10:49:22; rajesh; 
can't deploy current base until this is fixed.
column11:
10/10/11 10:49:24; rajesh; 
os: xp pro
browser: mozilla 5.0
login: shivoham
column13:
10/10/11 10:49:28; rajesh; 
not working on qa (2485) or on dev (2487). we want to not make the 2486 and 2487 changes in the main trunk, so they have to be first moved to a different trunk (or undone) before this problem is fixed

column1: internet explorer interface - right hand column is not aligned with main page
column2:
in ie (i am running 6.0) the right hand column is not aligned with the rest of the page.  it is shown at the pushed down at the bottom of the screen.  this is in both qa and www.  this is only on the app page on the tab "project summary"

username: shivoham (qa) and gramvikas (www)
browser: ie 6.0
urls: http://qa.peerwater.org/apps/173-Malgudi-Days/show_projects
http://peerwater.org/apps/77/show_projects

column1: if file name of attachment is too long it does not wrap text
column2:
http://qa.peerwater.org/projects/161-wer/attachments?type=photo

in mozilla, if file name of attachment is too long it does not wrap text and hence the "delete" and "edit" buttons are cut off.  this is only true of file name, not of title or description.  also, the file name automatically inserts underscores (_) for spaces when uploaded, that is why the filename becomes too long.  true for all pages, apps, project, profile, etc.  limit is ~75 characters before cutting off delete and edit buttons.

shivoham, gramvikas
mozilla 3.0
win xp

column1: reports should come opened
column2:
the status/visitor/peer reports blinds come collapsed and they collapse when you click on any report.

that means if there are multiple reports, you have to open the "Report" section each time.

1. best is not make this section non-collapse

2. if it is collapsible, if it is opened it should stay opened when you click a report
http://dev.rubyonrails.org/ticket/11233 had something about this

3. visitor report should stay open since we want visitors to easily submit reports and they might not find it if hidden (so #1 is best bet)

column1: email preferences do not work
column2:
http://qa.peerwater.org/apps/54-MANTRA/qandas

So basically the email filter feature is not working at all.  Regardless of the filter they have desired, the applicant always receives all emails from all other reviewers and third party/non-reviewers posting on their application.  Reviewers also always receive emails from applications they are reviewing regardless of the preferences they have set.  The applicant receives no email when they themselves post on their own application.  Overall, there is no filtering at all.

column1: upload a directory of stuff at a time
column2:

we can use this feature now for gram vikas import.

can we import a directory full of stuff?

all files in directory will be imported.
the file name minus file extension/type will become the title.

could be off the admin dashboard

a script to run on the server directly itself, with clear instructions on where to put the directory and what to name it.

column12:
10/10/11 10:50:49; rajesh; 
Had a conf call with the 2 photographers who visited Guatemala.

They took 6000 pix! About 200 are going on the BPR site.
They have a couple of hundred more that are documentary.
These will be helpful for people studying the project and the actual work and site and construction, etc.

We need to provide a way via PWX or ftp to do bulk uploads.

They are also hi-res, what are our options to make them web-res?

The codeset change might be fine, we need an interface for it.
Due to refresh can't see the changes to qa/159 that are mentioned.
column13:
10/10/11 10:50:52; ajaya; 
tricky stuff.
column14:
10/10/11 10:50:56; rajesh; 
here is some more clarity on the requirements:

1. target audience is photographers, volunteers, NOT implementers

2. we realize that titles will be a problem (need an intern or something)

3. we create ftp access on site5 where they can upload directory of stuff

4. step 1, is to file project report

5. step 2, is to upload directory of photos/documents

6. convention is to name directory "projXXX" or "projXXX-reportYYY" (note, 99% it will be peer report for photographers)

7. we will then import to appropriate proj_report or project

8. we will keep originals with geo-code info for use later

9. originals kept separate from data that gets refreshed on local/qa/...

column10:
10/10/11 10:52:00; ajaya; 
disabling the published_at date field for now.  This would default to the date report created.

Issues with date plugin.  Would watch.

changeset:2570

column1: sort project/status reports
column2:
project status reports attached to a project should appear chronlogically - sorted by date of report.

same for peer reports
same for visitor reports

column1: gram vikas dashboard blank
column2:
logged in as chitra on www

looked at a project and then clicked home: got a blank screen.
no matter what i do dashboard is completely blank.

www.peerwater.org/home_page works but then i click 'Home' and get blank screen
help, my profile, ... all work, but dashboard is blank.

view page source shows nothing.

logged out again.
logged in as ElPorvenir -> dashboard ok
logged out and logged in as protos -> dashboard ok
from other page, i logged out.
repeat login and get blank page.

logged out and logged in as bpr (rajesh) worked fine.
logged out and tried to login in as chitra and blank screen again.
column10:
10/10/11 10:52:03; rajesh; 
it stopped!
not an internet problem - definitely something on our site.

i was doing lots of things with gram vikas' projects and status reports.
other logins and orgs and pages worked - only not member dashboard.

keeping it alive.
column11:
10/10/11 10:52:06; ajaya; 
ok. keep a watch and let me know if it happens again.
column12:
10/10/11 10:52:08; rajesh; 
have seen it twice:

- 3 days ago logged on as admin. when i refreshed the page it came back.
- just now: http://peerwater.org/apps/236-Barangay-Indatauan-Artesian-Well-Development-for-Community-Water-Service/attachments/1113

it reproduces - i can go back to the app, click on all the pictures and see them, except this one. i saw it earlier, but now its blank.

on ie/xp/vmware, i can see it, but not ff.
works on safari also. so low priority, but need to trac
column14:
10/10/11 10:52:13; rajesh; 
on qa, logged in as protos.
blank screen for dashboard.
can go back (logout screen, home -> home page, home -> blank dashboard)

can go to map, about, but dashboard is blank.
logged out, home page, logged back in.

blank.
column15:
10/10/11 10:52:16; ajaya; 
donnow what to do abt this.

column1: choosing  drop down of number of projects per page causes crash
column2: on list of projects: choose 10,25,All and rails error
column10:
10/10/11 10:52:18; rajesh; 
does NOT happen on apps list.

only happens when seeing My Projects or My Active projects
NOT All Projects or All Ative Projects

column1: provide admin the ability to edit qanda
column2:
what is the effort involved to provide admin the ability to edit qanda?

- edit entries
- delete entries (lots of duplicates)
column11:
10/10/11 10:52:26; rajesh; 
the feature works well except that first time i deleted something with children and they all disappeared, it shocked me.

please remove the ability for users to edit their own comments for now.

confusing and potentially dangerous.

column1: improve attachment text
column2:
attachments show attached to "ProjReport" it should change:

ProjReport -> Project Report
App -> Application
Project -> Project

column1: org name needs to show up in funding agreement
column2:
now that the funding agreements are in the db and evaluated once, they don't seem to be able to evaluate inline code.

the agreement in qa has: <%= app.organization.name %> inside the text and nothing shows up.

can you show me how to get the name of org to show inside the agreement.

column1: user cannot edit their own email
column2:
when a user on qa (or local) rev 2583 edits their own email, it does not save it.
clicking save reverts to original email.

when admin edits, it sticks.

column1: enhance search to include reporter names and organizations
column2:
Need to index search so that reporter names are also searched.

So, if we searched for 'scott' not only would all Q&A in which scott participated show up, but any reports filed by scott.

This is needed urgently for Jin's demo on Sept 2.
column10:
10/10/11 10:52:44; rajesh; 
actually, the stuff works great!

the only problem is when a peer reviews the report - then the name is a link and not text and so does not get indexed.

so its a smaller problem to be solved but a greater fix.

at some point this should be fixed in the same way app-qandas are indexed

column1: visitor cannot upload photos sometimes
column2:
Mark is using qa and a couple of times has found the upload photo button missing after submitting a visitor report.

i have uploaded 5 reports on proj 1 & 2, and have found no problems on firefox on osx.

if mark has problems and reports, fine, otherwise we can close this tix.

column1: emails on qa did not get sent out
column2:
on tuesday sep 8, with the WOTR team, did 2 referrals and q&a.

some emails did not go out - esp. the 'congratulations ...'

is there a way to see what happened? a temp glitch or a deeper problem.

column1: checkbox for application to indicate whether its peer reviewed
column2:
need a checkbox on the application form, only visible to admin: Peer Reveiwed?

by default TRUE

provide some code on the Q&A and Ratings tab to use this flag.

rajesh will build on the code to change the text/screen to not show all the standard qanda / ratings, but something else
column10:
10/10/11 10:52:50; rajesh; 
one more database change while we are making them:

in project: add total_number_of_people_impacted - number

rajesh will add to project page ...
column12:
10/10/11 10:52:55; rajesh; 
thanks or the one change; we also need the first change:

need a checkbox on the application form, only visible to admin: Peer Reveiwed?

by default TRUE

provide some code on the Q&A and Ratings tab to use this flag.

rajesh will build on the code to change the text/screen to not show all the standard qanda / ratings, but something else
column13:
10/10/11 10:53:00; ajaya; 

12:04:57 PM AJ: need a checkbox on the application form, only visible to admin: Peer Reveiwed?
need a checkbox on the application form, only visible to admin: Peer Reveiwed?

12:05:01 PM AJ: why do u need that>?
12:05:19 PM AJ: we can find out whether if there was any review done or not
12:05:43 PM Rajesh Shah: i want to total up all the amounts of apps that are peer reviewed (not imported like gv) to show on the stats
12:07:37 PM AJ: but. we can see if an applicaton is peer reviewed or not by looking at if there was any review assigned for that app or now
12:07:38 PM AJ: not
12:08:41 PM Rajesh Shah: not always true. when someone applies for 5 of the same type of projects, only one is peer reviewed, and the others inherit the result of the first. but its clear that that type of project was peer reviewed
12:10:28 PM AJ: then let's create something in the app that shows that it is inhertiting review from some other app. 
12:10:43 PM AJ: just some random flag on a app is problem
12:11:50 PM Rajesh Shah: with that flag on the q&a tab, we can also add: "This app was presented directly to the funder by the implementer, not requiring peer review"
12:12:16 PM Rajesh Shah: we can also disable the ratings tab
12:12:32 PM Rajesh Shah: its not a random flag, but quite insightul
12:14:15 PM AJ: here is what I am coming from. . If you have some functionality that you thing PWX can provide, then we need to make it part of PWX in more structured  way from data perspective. so.  If we have an app that doesn't need Peer Review, then thats a feature and we define something like app requrierements and peer review would be one of them and set to off for the one not needing one. 
12:14:38 PM AJ: so . we can code in such way that we can check if peer review is needed or not  and do whatever. 
12:15:03 PM AJ: but having a flag. that implies peer review inherited is quite diff from peeer review not needed
12:15:29 PM AJ: so a hack should be avoided as much if we can formalize the needed
12:15:31 PM AJ: needs
12:16:59 PM Rajesh Shah: i like that. and its almost what i am looking for. when a non-peer reviewed app comes in (eg. GV) i skip the 'distribute app' and jump to the 'enter final status'

since these are manual and i don't see even after WOTR, a need to add programming, lets keep it simple
12:17:39 PM Rajesh Shah: we can add a 'needs peer review' flag - its the same as 'peer reviewed' but if it makes you happy ...
12:17:56 PM AJ: no. no. not about me being happy. 
12:18:14 PM AJ: I am debating the approaches. 
12:18:44 PM AJ: just saying what u said earlier. and trying to make sense
12:19:46 PM Rajesh Shah: all i am saying, for now it can be manual process to go back and mark all GV apps that are not peer reviewed. then we can at least use the total of peer review amounts.

later we can add code to streamline process if we have to handle many apps
12:20:44 PM AJ: why not just count the amounts now and update the amounts manually. easier then making hacks in the DB
12:21:48 PM Rajesh Shah: well, i also wanted to change the tabs (q&a, ratings) text for people looking thru apps
12:22:07 PM AJ: u r contradicting yrself.
12:22:18 PM Rajesh Shah: expand.
12:22:28 PM AJ: hen we can at least use the total of peer review amounts.
12:22:41 PM AJ: and now u want to use that to show other functionality
12:22:44 PM AJ: and change
12:23:02 PM Rajesh Shah: yes, but its not change in process or code. its only if then
12:23:21 PM AJ: alright man. talking to a wall now
12:23:50 PM Rajesh Shah: if we put a flag "needs peer review" then we can use that flag for counting and displaying text. i think what you were thinking of the process of assigning reviewers, etc. that is code to me.
12:25:21 PM AJ: alright
12:25:33 PM Rajesh Shah: http://peerwater.org/apps/23-Drinking-Water-Project-Kombadwadi-hamlet/qandas#qanda-196
12:26:16 PM Rajesh Shah: and the ratings
12:26:53 PM AJ: brb
12:27:04 PM Rajesh Shah: i think you are thinking of 3 classes: peer review, inherited, and not reviewed
12:27:09 PM Rajesh Shah: brb?
12:28:32 PM Rajesh Shah: then for inherited we would link to the parent app and show that data. more thorough solution, i agree, but more code and testing.
Changed status to Offline (12:44:02 PM)

column1: news: cannot edit
column2:
logged in as admin:

http://peerwater.org/news/admin

clicking on 'edit' button on any news item does not work - nothing happens. the 'show' button works.

'delete' works (tested on dev), but needs a page refresh to show it works. don't remember its earlier behavior.

column1: search should include press releases and blog
column2:
add a section to search results at the bottom:

Misc (blog, news, help, ...)

and show search results ...
column11:
10/10/11 10:53:19; rajesh; 
if its not trouble, lets put news in the search.

----------

in january we are having a discussion on requirements for reporting for the cisco grant. we need to show the groups involvement and that we are creating reports to serve the community.

i was planning to use the blog.

any ideas if we want to make that discussion searchable?

column1: 2 major UI problems
column2:
on qa, after deploying all the video code, there are 2 problems that need to be fixed before we can send video out (which is urgent)

1. contact (venetian blind) does not work (works on dev & www, but not qa)

2. member dashboard rhs is messed out with org searchbox moving left


i looked at all the changes since rev 2599, but can't see anything obvious. something with yui layout?
column11:
10/10/11 10:53:27; rajesh; 
contact cannot be seen on video page.

anyway to fix this?

<nowhere as important as before>
column12:
10/10/11 10:53:30; ajaya; 
Don't think a bug anymore! Is it?

column1: need a pwx statistic calculated
column2:
need to put a beneficiary count in the pwx stats.

total from all approved/accepted projects of max of (#people water, #school kids, #sanitation)

please put appropriate sql code in the pwx stats file.

i can polish and deploy.

thanks.

column1: add last login field to user
column2:
another db change (two left)

can we add a date/time field for last login.

so viewing profile, admin can see what it is.

should be nil (not start with today)

column1: reduce db load on home page (stats, etc)
column2:
since our numbers don't change that much, we should just do all the stats db lookups once a day and put them in global variables.

the home & about pages, then don't need to do db calls to display the number.

column1: gram vikas name shows up on project well projects
column2:
mapping project well, the title shows up as gram vikas:
http://peerwater.org/map/organizations/12-Project-Well

also map of SDTT has the same problem
http://peerwater.org/map/organizations/57-Sir-Dorabji-Tata-Trust-and-Allied-Trusts

this happened at the arghyam demo and i saw it also in another spot.
can't remember the 2nd problem, it was similar but ...

column1: add site names into search
column2:
now that we have many sites, people might search for the site by the 2 fields: village name, district/state name.

don't know how the country name can be indexed, will need a separate section in search engine for 'project locations'.
lets do that in the future if too difficult/complex now.

the site locations should be in the search engine.

column1: map acts wierdly - clicking on icon jumps elsewhere
column2:
instead of popping a bubble up where the drop is, it opens it elsewhere.


----- mark writes -------
Hey Guys
I think I mentioned this before, but didn't send the examples.
Some hover-over bubbles on the map for certain locations take you to a completely different place on the map when clicked.

Here's an example.

If you zoom on the map to the RWHT at Church of God of Prophecy Primary School project Drop Icon (marked by the arrow in the screen shot) in Sierra Leone and click on it, the map zooms to Atlanta.

column1: remove non-peer reviewed apps from map
column2: apps for gv which are placeholders don't need to be shown on the map, for now anyway.

column2:
http://peerwater.org/apps/74-Arsenic-Safe-Drinking-Water-Gaighata-Phase-2/show_projects

the Earliest Date Started is the latest
and

column1: org summary in rhs (possibly) of org profile
column2:
be nice to have an org summary in the right column:

- org type

- org roles

- $ funded (if any)

- # of applications

- $ of total value of app

- $ of request (in app)

- # of apps approved

- $ granted

- # of projects

- $ of projects (maybe only for admin to see for now)

- $ of total value of projects

- # of reviews invited to

- # of reviews done (can we also count reviews without comments?)

- # of qandas participated in (not # of questions asked)

this is like a report
column10:
10/10/11 10:53:50; rajesh; 
the amount funded should be calculated from applications, since projects can take their time.

if we can put code in for:
- funds from apps
- funds from cycles (commented out)
- funds from projects (commented out)

that would be the best for auditing purposes and cleaning up data

column1: list of funded projects
column2:
we have a new funder this week.
and a good list for funders would be list projects funded by them.

so, an option #5 "Projects Funded" by the org, if org is selected and is a funder, and by self (if org is not selected) is needed.

would be nice to offer option only to orgs who are funders, but not important enough to do a lot of coding.

http://peerwater.org/organizations/2

shows a very long RHS and we have not even updated all projects!
can we shorten list like projects and apps?

column1: project list tab in application has issues when no projects or not logged in
column2:
without logging in: http://peerwater.org/apps/217

click on project list" tab and it goes to home page.
login as admin and then it goes to the project admin page for that app.

sure it has something to do with going to a restricted page and then allowing when logged in.

however, in case it is a bug ...

the main change need is to disable project list tab for !(admin or owner) until there is at least one projects, or at least funding is accepted (probably much easier & faster than project count). right now, its only disabled until app is approved.

column1: project has funder assigned while application does not
column2:
each approved application gets a funder assignment.

only then can the projects of that application get funder info.

Project 70, 111, 126 were found to have funder info while application did not.
it was fixed by AJ on www, but we need to see if it happens again, and how.
column10:

ticket:8675 was also caused by this.

column1: org count discrepancy
column2:
the org count in pwx stats shows 59 orgs.

sql query in org db shows 60 orgs.

why the difference?
column10:
10/10/11 10:54:21; ajaya; 
This is the query we are doing now
{{{
SELECT `organizations`.`id`                    AS t0_r0,
       `organizations`.`name`                  AS t0_r1,
       `organizations`.`type_id`               AS t0_r2,
       `organizations`.`date_founded`          AS t0_r3,
       `organizations`.`focus_id`              AS t0_r4,
       `organizations`.`comments`              AS t0_r5,
       `organizations`.`backgrounds`           AS t0_r6,
       `organizations`.`history`               AS t0_r7,
       `organizations`.`water_revenue`         AS t0_r8,
       `organizations`.`non_water_revenue`     AS t0_r9,
       `organizations`.`ranking`               AS t0_r10,
       `organizations`.`reviewer`              AS t0_r11,
       `organizations`.`date_of_joining`       AS t0_r12,
       `organizations`.`url`                   AS t0_r13,
       `organizations`.`created_at`            AS t0_r14,
       `organizations`.`updated_at`            AS t0_r15,
       `organizations`.`sec_focus_id`          AS t0_r16,
       `organizations`.`organization_synopsis` AS t0_r17,
       `organizations`.`showmethemoney`        AS t0_r18,
       `org_statuses`.`id`                     AS t1_r0,
       `org_statuses`.`organization_id`        AS t1_r1,
       `org_statuses`.`status_id`              AS t1_r2,
       `org_statuses`.`expiration_date`        AS t1_r3,
       `org_statuses`.`created_at`             AS t1_r4,
       `org_statuses`.`updated_at`             AS t1_r5,
       `org_valid_statuses`.`id`               AS t2_r0,
       `org_valid_statuses`.`status`           AS t2_r1,
       `org_valid_statuses`.`description`      AS t2_r2,
       `org_valid_statuses`.`created_at`       AS t2_r3,
       `org_valid_statuses`.`updated_at`       AS t2_r4
FROM   `organizations`
       LEFT OUTER JOIN `org_statuses`
         ON org_statuses.organization_id = organizations.id
       LEFT OUTER JOIN `org_valid_statuses`
         ON `org_valid_statuses`.id = `org_statuses`.status_id
       LEFT JOIN referrals
         ON organizations.id = referrals.r_organization_id
WHERE  ((org_valid_statuses.status = 'valid')
        AND (referrals.status_id IN (5,6)
              OR referrals.status_id IS NULL)) 
}}}

I don't know what query you are talking about.  The following one as u said yesterday returns 69 results.
{{{
SELECT o.`name` , `date_of_joining` , c.`printable_name`
FROM `org_addresses` , `countries` AS c, organizations AS o
WHERE o.id = `organization_id`
AND org_addresses.`country_id` = c.`id`
}}}

can that be explained?

column1: withdrawn app shows up on reviewers dashboard
column2:
the entire app process is messed up with the new flags and code!

http://qa.peerwater.org/apps/252

login as rajesh (bpr)
the app was withdrawn but it still shows up on the dashboard
qandas and ratings are greyed out.

also, when you withdraw and resubmit, the ratings stay instead of getting cleaned up.

 "_method"=>"put",
 "id"=>"126-Gravity-Flow-Water-Supply-System-for-S-Antarasingh-Village-Gajapati-district-Orissa-",
 "project"=>{"name"=>"Gravity Flow Water Supply System for S.Antarasingh Village,
Gajapati district,
 Orissa.",
 "start_date(1i)"=>"2009",
 "final_cost"=>"3587",
 "people_drinking_details"=>"S.Antarasingh,
 is a  tribal village in the Anandapur Project of Gram vikas,
 Gajapati District,
Orissa.  The village is home to 19 households,
 all belonging to  Saura tribes and 8 of the households are classified  under Below Poverty Line (BPL). There are 43 women  and 51 men  living in the village.\r\nSource of Data: Monthly Progress Reports(MPRs)",
 "other_issues"=>"",
 "start_date(2i)"=>"3",
 "no_people_getting_sanitation"=>"94",
 "maintainance_revenue"=>"Gravity flow water supply system does not use any external energy to supply water for families. In gravity flow,
 water from a spring or a well on a higher altitude than the village flows to the village overhead water tank,
 using the principles of gravity from where it is again distributed through pipes to all families round the clock. Gram Vikas is innovating and experimenting with the gravity flow design to minimize costs and to maintain a round the clock water supply to rural homes especially in rural areas.Therefore people don't need to pay cost for electricity charges. People also collect O&M cost for future repair of pipelines and infrastructures put in place for water supply.   Also interest earned from the Corpus deposit is used to meet the social costs of extending the water and sanitation system to new households in the future,
 ensuring 100% coverage at all times. ",
 "start_date(3i)"=>"1",
 "amount_funded"=>"3587",
 "people_other_details"=>" Presently one women savings and credit group ,
  consisting of 16members,
 function in the village. The group is engaged in doing seasonal minor business like collecting tamarind. A total of 15 nos of Improved  Chulhas have been constructed in the village. ",
 "narratives"=>"Gram Vikas implemented the community led Gravity Flow Piped Water Supply and Sanitation system in the village Kerandi,
 supported by  Blue Planet Run (BPR) Foundation. The work was implemented with less cost,
 as projected earlier in the proposal,
 due to substantial contribution by the people . Therefore we would like to utilise the remaining fund for  S.Antarasingh,
 also a tribal village,
 in the district of Gajpati,
 Orissa. The total amount used for Kerandi was Rs.1,
55,
589 of the allocated Rs.2,
99,
102. Gram Vikas would therefore like to submit this proposal to use the remaining Rs.1,
43,
512 for S.Antarasingh,
  for community led gravity flow piped water supply system . ",
 "learnings"=>"Process of Implementation:\r\nThe project is guided by five core values: inclusion,
 social equity,
 gender equity,
 sustainability and cost sharing. It uses water and sanitation as the entry point activity to unite the community . under this core rallying point the community is organised to take action to improve its well-being and environment. Before the programme begins in any village,
 the village must come to a consensus that all families,
 without exception,
 will participate. This brings the community together across barriers of caste,
 gender and economic status,
 which for centuries have excluded large sections of communities from the process of development. The village must also raise a corpus fund of Rs.1,
000 ($22) per household with the better-off paying more and the poorer less. The corpus fund is an acid test,
 demonstrating that the community is committed to the process of development. Interest from the Corpus fund is used to meet the social costs of extending the water and sanitation system to new households in the future,
 ensuring 100% coverage at all times. \r\nWomen and children are the greatest beneficiaries of this programme - women benefiting from being spared the drudgery of fetching water for household uses and children,
 escaping the clutches of water-borne diseases,
 which result in widespread morbidity and mortality.\r\nAccess to sanitation is not only a matter of hygiene,
 it is a statement in dignity - it restores to the rural folk,
 especially women,
 their self-respect and dignity and helps the community to improve their health status. \r\n",
 "school_children_drinking_details"=>"",
 "focus_id"=>"1",
 "no_people_impacted"=>"",
 "no_school_children_affected_drinking"=>"0",
 "implementor_name"=>"",
 "no_people_affected_drinking"=>"94",
 "people_sanitation_details"=>" S.Antarasingh  is a tribal village in the  Gajapati district of Orissa.  The district is predominantly a tribal district in the state.The village is home to 94 people consisting of 19 households ,
 all belonging to scheduled tribes,
 and 8 of the households have been categorized under  Below Poverty Line (BPL). There are 43 women and 51 men (including 14 children below 5 years of age)living in the  village. ",
 "status_id"=>"3",
